<id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.1.1_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 2.1.1 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.1.1_released"/>     <updated>2015-03-03T09:35:00Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 2.1.1 released<p>March 2 2015. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.1.1" title="Semantic MediaWiki 2.1.1" class="mw-redirect">Semantic MediaWiki 2.1.1</a>, is a bugfix release and has now been released.</b> This new version is a minor release and provides bugfixes for the current 2.1 branch of Semantic MediaWiki. See the page <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation_2.x" title="Help:Installation 2.x" class="mw-redirect">Installation</a> for details on how to install, upgrade or update. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.1.1_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 2.1.1 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 2.1.1 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.1_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 2.1 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.1_released"/>     <updated>2015-01-21T17:33:48Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 2.1 released<p>January 19 2015. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.1" title="Semantic MediaWiki 2.1" class="mw-redirect">Semantic MediaWiki 2.1</a>, the next version after 2.0, has now been released.</b> This new version provides new features most notably adding <a href="/wiki/Help:SMWSearch" title="Help:SMWSearch">support for semantic queries in Special:Search</a>, providing <a href="/wiki/Help:$smwgEnabledEditPageHelp#Examples" title="Help:$smwgEnabledEditPageHelp">contextual help texts on edit pages</a> as well as introducing full support for PostgreSQL as relational database backend. Also further substantial SPARQLStore improvements have been made. Additionally it fixes a lot of bugs and brings many stability improvements and enhancements. Automated software testing was again further expanded to assure software stability. See the page <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation_2.x" title="Help:Installation 2.x" class="mw-redirect">Installation</a> for details on how to install and upgrade. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.1_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 2.1 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-fr"><a href="/wiki/Lancement_de_Semantic_MediaWiki_2.1" title="Lancement de Semantic MediaWiki 2.1">fr</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.1_uitgebracht" title="Semantic MediaWiki 2.1 uitgebracht">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 2.1 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2015_to_be_held_in_St._Louis,_Missouri,_USA</id>   <title>SMWCon Spring 2015 to be held in St. Louis, Missouri, USA</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2015_to_be_held_in_St._Louis,_Missouri,_USA"/>     <updated>2014-12-11T18:28:19Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Spring 2015 to be held in St. Louis, Missouri, USA<p>December 11, 2014. The location and dates of the next <a href="/wiki/SMWCon" title="SMWCon">SMWCon</a>, or Semantic MediaWiki Conference, have been announced: it will be held in St. Louis, Missouri, USA (a city located in the Mid-Western USA which may be called "Gateway to the West") on May 6-8, 2015. It will be hosted at T-REX, a co-working space and tech incubator.  The first day will include tutorials for beginners to SMW; this will be followed by a two-day regular conference. </p><p>For more information, see the <b><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2015" title="SMWCon Spring 2015">SMWCon Spring 2015</a></b> homepage. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fr%C3%BChjahr_2015_in_St._Louis,_Missouri,_USA" title="SMWCon Fr\ufffd\ufffdhjahr 2015 in St. Louis, Missouri, USA">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Spring 2015 to be held in St. Louis, Missouri, USA</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.0_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 2.0 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.0_released"/>     <updated>2014-08-05T16:08:30Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 2.0 released<p>August 4 2014. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.0" title="Semantic MediaWiki 2.0">Semantic MediaWiki 2.0</a>, the next major version after 1.9.2, has now been released.</b> This new version provides new features most notably adding support for the <a href="/wiki/Help:FusekiHttpDatabaseConnector" title="Help:FusekiHttpDatabaseConnector" class="mw-redirect">"Jena Fuseki" RDF backend</a> and improves support for the <a href="/wiki/Help:FourstoreHttpDatabaseConnector" title="Help:FourstoreHttpDatabaseConnector" class="mw-redirect">"4store"</a> as well as <a href="/wiki/Help:VirtuosoHttpDatabaseConnector" title="Help:VirtuosoHttpDatabaseConnector" class="mw-redirect">"Virtuoso"</a> RDF backends. Also support of <a href="/wiki/Help:Adding_subobjects#Specifying_a_sortkey" title="Help:Adding subobjects">subobjects</a> was enhanced. Additionally it fixes a lot of bugs and brings many stability improvements and enhancements. Automated software testing was further expanded to assure software stability. See the page <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation_2.x" title="Help:Installation 2.x" class="mw-redirect">Installation</a> for details on how to install and upgrade. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_2.0_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 2.0 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 2.0 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.2_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.2 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.2_released"/>     <updated>2014-04-19T10:57:32Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.2 released<p>April 18 2014. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.2" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.2">Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.2</a>, the next minor version after 1.9.1, has now been released.</b> This new version adds a new features e.g. an <a href="/wiki/Help:Object_ID_lookup" title="Help:Object ID lookup">object ID lookup</a> or <a href="/wiki/Demo:Template_with_tabular_output_and_math_functions" title="Demo:Template with tabular output and math functions">making the result querystring available to templates</a>, fixes bugs and brings many stability improvements and enhancements. See the page <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation_1.9.x" title="Help:Installation 1.9.x" class="mw-redirect">Installation</a> for details on how to install and upgrade. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.2_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.2 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.2 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.1_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.1 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.1_released"/>     <updated>2014-02-09T10:43:10Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.1 released<p>February 9 2014. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.1" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.1">Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.1</a>, the next minor version after 1.9.0, has now been released.</b> This new version adds a few new features e.g. two new <a href="/wiki/Help:Special_properties" title="Help:Special properties">special properties</a>, fixes bugs and brings many stability improvements and enhancements. See the page <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation_1.9.x" title="Help:Installation 1.9.x" class="mw-redirect">Installation</a> for details on how to install and upgrade. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.1_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.1 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.1 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.0_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.0 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.0_released"/>     <updated>2014-01-07T07:16:48Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.0 released<p>January 3 2014. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.0" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.0">Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.0</a>, the next major version after 1.8.0, has now been released.</b> This new version adds a lot of important new features and enhancements, fixes bugs and brings major improvements to the code and its stability. </p><p>Noteworthy improvements are the availability of many new code tests which assure and improve platform stability as well as the introduced support for the dependency manager <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.getcomposer.org/">Composer</a> which helps installing and upgrading SMW and thus is the new installing method of choice. Other important changes include better performance mechanisms (new parameters, new script), improvements of the parser functions <a href="/wiki/Help:Adding_subobjects" title="Help:Adding subobjects">"#subobject"</a> and <a href="/wiki/Help:Setting_values" title="Help:Setting values">"#set"</a> (multiple value support), new and enhanced <a href="/wiki/Ask_API" title="Ask API">API modules</a> ("browsebysubject", "smwinfo"), new special page <a href="/wiki/Help:Special:Concepts" title="Help:Special:Concepts">"Concepts"</a> as well as the new "smw-admin" user right. Further information about what is new may be read on the <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.0" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.0">SMW 1.9.0 page</a>. </p><p>Please refer to the help page on <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation" title="Help:Installation">installing</a> or on <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation#Upgrading" title="Help:Installation">upgrading</a> Semantic MediaWiki to get detailed instructions on how to do these tasks. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.0_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.0 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.9.0_uitgebracht" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.0 uitgebracht">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 1.9.0 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Saruman</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_Google%2B_community_created</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki Google+ community created</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_Google%2B_community_created"/>     <updated>2013-11-10T13:08:13Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki Google+ community created<p>November 10, 2013. On October 10, a <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/116734870170248785360">Semantic MediaWiki "community"</a> was created on the social networking site Google+, by SMW developer and user <a href="/wiki/User:Samuel_Lampa" title="User:Samuel Lampa">Samuel Lampa</a>. The Google+ community has, in its first full month of operation, gained 120 members. It is used regularly for announcements, questions and discussions, usually of a less technical nature than those found on the SMW mailing lists. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Gemeinschaft_zu_Semantic_MediaWiki_bei_Google%2B_gegr%C3%BCndet" title="Gemeinschaft zu Semantic MediaWiki bei Google+ gegr\ufffd\ufffdndet">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_Google%2B_community_gestart" title="Semantic MediaWiki Google+ community gestart">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki Google+ community created</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Yaron Koren</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2014_to_be_held_in_Montreal,_Canada</id>   <title>SMWCon Spring 2014 to be held in Montreal, Canada</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2014_to_be_held_in_Montreal,_Canada"/>     <updated>2013-11-03T12:06:20Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Spring 2014 to be held in Montreal, Canada<p>November 3, 2013. It was announced at the end of the <a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2013" title="SMWCon Fall 2013">Berlin SMWCon</a> that the next Semantic MediaWiki Conference will take place on May 21-23, 2014 at Concordia University in Montreal, Canada. It will be hosted and co-organized by Prof. Ren\ufffd\ufffd Witte of the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.semanticsoftware.info/">Semantic Software Lab</a> at Concordia, where SMW is used to do <a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2013/Smarter_Wikis" title="SMWCon Spring 2013/Smarter Wikis">machine annotation of texts</a>. </p><p>This will be the first SMWCon to take place outside of Europe and the United States. </p><p>For more information, see <a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2014" title="SMWCon Spring 2014">SMWCon Spring 2014</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fr%C3%BChjahr_2014_findet_in_Montreal,_Kanada_statt" title="SMWCon Fr\ufffd\ufffdhjahr 2014 findet in Montreal, Kanada statt">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Spring 2014 to be held in Montreal, Canada</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Yaron Koren</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2013_a_big_success</id>   <title>SMWCon Fall 2013 a big success</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2013_a_big_success"/>     <updated>2013-11-03T11:57:07Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Fall 2013 a big success<p>October 31, 2013. The <a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2013" title="SMWCon Fall 2013">Fall 2013 Semantic MediaWiki Conference</a> was held in Berlin, Germany on October 28-30, 2013. As general chair <a href="/wiki/Benedikt_K%C3%A4mpgen" title="Benedikt K\ufffd\ufffdmpgen" class="mw-redirect">Benedikt K\ufffd\ufffdmpgen</a> stated in his opening remarks, this was by far the largest SMWCon, with 86 attendees from 17 countries. Attendance would have been even higher if registration had not been closed three weeks before the event due to the limitations of the venue. This was also the first SMWCon to have two tracks, enabling tutorials for both users and developers during the tutorial day. </p><p>The event had the highest-ever number of talks, covering the current state and future plans for the software, as well as a wide variety of uses in business, science and government. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Herbst_2013_war_ein_gro%C3%9Fer_Erfolg" title="SMWCon Herbst 2013 war ein gro\ufffd\ufffder Erfolg">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Fall 2013 a big success</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Yaron Koren</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2013_registration_open</id>   <title>SMWCon Fall 2013 registration open</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2013_registration_open"/>     <updated>2013-08-22T14:56:23Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Fall 2013 registration open<p>August 22, 2013. The registration for the next SMWCon Fall in Berlin, Germany (October 28-30, 2013) is now open. All interested participants can register at the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://de.amiando.com/PVADAOV.html">ticketing site</a>. </p><p>For more information on this and the conference, see the <b><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2013" title="SMWCon Fall 2013">SMWCon Fall 2013</a></b> homepage. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Anmeldung_zur_SMWCon_Herbst_2013_nun_m%C3%B6glich" title="Anmeldung zur SMWCon Herbst 2013 nun m\ufffd\ufffdglich">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon_Fall_2013_registration_open</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2013_to_be_held_in_Berlin,_Germany</id>   <title>SMWCon Fall 2013 to be held in Berlin, Germany</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2013_to_be_held_in_Berlin,_Germany"/>     <updated>2013-06-18T16:01:19Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Fall 2013 to be held in Berlin, Germany<p>June 18, 2013. The location and dates of the next <a href="/wiki/SMWCon" title="SMWCon">SMWCon</a>, or Semantic MediaWiki Conference, have been announced: it will be held at <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.aohostels.com/en/tagungen/tagungen-berlin/">A&amp;O Berlin Hauptbahnhof</a> in Berlin, Germany on October 28-30, 2013. The first day will include tutorials for beginners to SMW; this will be followed by a two-day regular conference. </p><p>For more information, see the <b><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2013" title="SMWCon Fall 2013">SMWCon Fall 2013</a></b> homepage. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Herbst_2013_findet_in_Berlin_statt" title="SMWCon Herbst 2013 findet in Berlin statt">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Fall 2013 to be held in Berlin, Germany</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMW_users_survey_results_published</id>   <title>SMW users survey results published</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMW_users_survey_results_published"/>     <updated>2013-03-08T22:50:46Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMW users survey results published<p>March 7, 2013. From January 10 to 28, 2013, the <a href="/wiki/SMW_Project" title="SMW Project" class="mw-redirect">SMW Project</a> ran a short online survey of the community, asking mostly about priorities for future development of Semantic MediaWiki and related extensions. The results of that survey have finally published on this site; you can see them at the page <a href="/wiki/SMW_users_survey_results" title="SMW users survey results">SMW users survey results</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Ergebnisse_der_Nutzerumfrage_wurden_ver%C3%B6ffentlicht" title="Ergebnisse der Nutzerumfrage wurden ver\ufffd\ufffdffentlicht">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMW users survey results published</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Yaron Koren</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Wikidata_begins_to_store_actual_data</id>   <title>Wikidata begins to store actual data</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Wikidata_begins_to_store_actual_data"/>     <updated>2013-02-06T23:05:46Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Wikidata begins to store actual data<p>February 4, 2013. The <a href="http://wikidata.org/wiki/Wikidata:Main_Page" class="extiw" title="wikidata:Wikidata:Main Page">Wikidata</a> project reached a major milestone, when it began to store information about each Wikidata "entity" in those entities' own pages. This goal, which is the start of what is known as "Phase 2", means that Wikidata can begin to hold the data used for infoboxes in Wikipedia, so that one day each language Wikipedia will no longer have to store its own infobox information. This process will also have the side effect of creating the world's largest structured database of general-knowledge information. </p><p>Wikidata does not run on Semantic MediaWiki, although it uses code originally created for Semantic MediaWiki, that is now being spun off into an independent library, "DataValues", that will be used by both sets of software. Additionally, some of the Wikidata team are affiliated with the <a href="/wiki/SMW_Project" title="SMW Project" class="mw-redirect">SMW Project</a>, most notably Wikidata team leader <a href="/wiki/Denny_Vrandecic" title="Denny Vrandecic" class="mw-redirect">Denny Vrandecic</a>. </p><p>For more information, see the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://blog.wikimedia.de/2013/02/04/first-parts-of-phase-2-of-wikidata-going-live/">Wikidata announcement</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Wikidata_beginnt_mit_dem_direkten_Speichern_von_Daten" title="Wikidata beginnt mit dem direkten Speichern von Daten">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Wikidata_begint_met_het_daadwerkelijk_vastleggen_van_data" title="Wikidata begint met het daadwerkelijk vastleggen van data">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Wikidata begins to store actual data</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Survey:_What_do_you_want_from_SMW%3F</id>   <title>Survey: What do you want from SMW?</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Survey:_What_do_you_want_from_SMW%3F"/>     <updated>2013-11-06T13:00:21Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Survey: What do you want from SMW?<p>January 10, 2013. The <a href="/wiki/SMW_Project" title="SMW Project" class="mw-redirect">SMW Project</a> has prepared a short online survey for the community to gather input which will help to plan the future development activities and resources related to Semantic MediaWiki. It is mostly multiple choice but also includes a free-form box for your comments and thoughts. You will find it at the following location: <a rel="nofollow" class="external free" href="http://bit.ly/smwsurvey">http://bit.ly/smwsurvey</a>. We love to hear from you and appreciate you having your say. Thank you for your participation. The results of the survey will be reported publicly <a href="/wiki/SMW_users_survey_results" title="SMW users survey results">here</a>. </p><p><b>Update:</b> The results of this survey were published at <a href="/wiki/SMW_users_survey_results" title="SMW users survey results">SMW users survey results</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Umfrage:_Was_erwarten_Sie_von_SMW%3F" title="Umfrage: Was erwarten Sie von SMW?">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Enquete:_Wat_verwacht_je_van_SMW" title="Enquete: Wat verwacht je van SMW">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Survey: What do you want from SMW?</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Yaron Koren</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012_talks_and_presentations_on_YouTube</id>   <title>SMWCon Fall 2012 talks and presentations on YouTube</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012_talks_and_presentations_on_YouTube"/>     <updated>2012-12-07T21:02:35Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Fall 2012 talks and presentations on YouTube<p>December 7, 2012. Videos of talks and presentations from <b><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012" title="SMWCon Fall 2012">SMWCon Fall 2012</a></b>, which was held on October 24-26 in Cologne, Germany, have been uploaded to YouTube. The entire set of videos is viewable <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLwtfwT1GnUQRaLki-YcF-_n8ndayi--W5">here</a>. Additionally the videos were added to the pages describing the respective talks and presentations. The event itself was a big success, with over 50 attendees representing developers and users from all over the world. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Videomitschnitte_der_SMWCon_Herbst_2012_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Videomitschnitte der SMWCon Herbst 2012 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012_talks_en_presentaties_op_YouTube" title="SMWCon Fall 2012 talks en presentaties op YouTube">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Fall 2012 talks and presentations on YouTube</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.8.0_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 1.8.0 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.8.0_released"/>     <updated>2012-12-02T22:38:43Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 1.8.0 released<p>December 2 2012. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.8.0" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.8.0">Semantic MediaWiki 1.8.0</a>, the next major version after 1.7.1, has now been released.</b> This new version adds a lot of important new features, fixes bugs and brings improvements to the code. </p><p>The most noteworthy feature is the new SQLStore (version 3) as a data backend which substantially increases efficiency and reduces database activity of SMW. Other important changes include improvements to the user interface of special page <a href="/wiki/Help:Special:Ask" title="Help:Special:Ask">"Ask"</a>, the new result format <a href="/wiki/Help:Feed_format" title="Help:Feed format">"atom"</a>, the ability to query information about queries and the further enhancements that were made to parser function <a href="/wiki/Help:Adding_subobjects" title="Help:Adding subobjects">"#subobject"</a>. Also  the <a href="/wiki/Ask_API" title="Ask API">API modules</a> for doing ask-like queries are now stable, with added continuation support. Further information about what is new may be read on the <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.8.0" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.8.0">SMW 1.8.0 page</a>. </p><p>Please refer to the help page on <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation" title="Help:Installation">installing</a> or on <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation#Upgrading_existing_installations" title="Help:Installation">upgrading</a> Semantic MediaWiki to get detailed instructions on how to do these tasks. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.8.0_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.8.0 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-fr"><a href="/wiki/Lancement_de_Semantic_MediaWiki_1.8.0" title="Lancement de Semantic MediaWiki 1.8.0">fr</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.8.0_uitgebracht" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.8.0 uitgebracht">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 1.8.0 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/New_book,_%22Working_with_MediaWiki%22,_by_SMW_developer_Yaron_Koren</id>   <title>New book, "Working with MediaWiki", by SMW developer Yaron Koren</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/New_book,_%22Working_with_MediaWiki%22,_by_SMW_developer_Yaron_Koren"/>     <updated>2012-11-26T18:29:01Z</updated>      <summary type="html">New book, "Working with MediaWiki", by SMW developer Yaron Koren<p>November 26 2012. A new book, <i><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://workingwithmediawiki.com">Working with MediaWiki</a></i>, has been released, written by MediaWiki/Semantic MediaWiki developer, consultant and hoster <a href="/wiki/Yaron_Koren" title="Yaron Koren" class="mw-redirect">Yaron Koren</a>. <i>Working with MediaWiki</i> is a general reference guide for MediaWiki, intended for both beginning and advanced MediaWiki administrators. The book discusses many of MediaWiki's extensions as well, and about 1/3 of the book covers Semantic MediaWiki and its related extensions. </p><p><i>Working with MediaWiki</i> is the first MediaWiki reference book published since 2010, and it is the first one to cover Semantic MediaWiki to any significant extent. It is available as a printed book, an e-book and a PDF. </p><p>Yaron is best known in the SMW community for being the main author of the extension <a href="/wiki/Semantic_Forms" title="Semantic Forms">Semantic Forms</a>. He is also the author of around 10 other extensions, runs the SMW-based wiki farm <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://referata.com">Referata</a>, and runs the MediaWiki consulting company <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://wikiworks.com">WikiWorks</a>. </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/%E2%80%9EWorking_with_MediaWiki%E2%80%9C,_ein_Buch_von_SMW-Entwickler_Yaron_Koren_wurde_ver%C3%B6ffentlicht" title="\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdWorking with MediaWiki\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, ein Buch von SMW-Entwickler Yaron Koren wurde ver\ufffd\ufffdffentlicht">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Nieuw_boek,_%22Working_with_MediaWiki%22,_door_SMW_ontwikkelaar_Yaron_Koren" title="Nieuw boek, &quot;Working with MediaWiki&quot;, door SMW ontwikkelaar Yaron Koren">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">New book, "Working with MediaWiki", by SMW developer Yaron Koren</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Saruman</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2013_to_be_held_in_New_York_City</id>   <title>SMWCon Spring 2013 to be held in New York City</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2013_to_be_held_in_New_York_City"/>     <updated>2012-11-02T20:26:15Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Spring 2013 to be held in New York City<p>November 2, 2012. It was announced on October 26, at the end of the Fall 2012 SMWCon, that the next SMWCon, or Semantic MediaWiki Conference, will be held in New York City, in the United States, on March 20-22, 2013. The conference will take place at <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://itp.nyu.edu/itp/">ITP</a>, or the Interactive Telecommunication's Program, which is part of New York University. The first day will include tutorials for beginners to SMW; this will be followed by a two-day regular conference. </p><p>For more information, see the <b><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2013" title="SMWCon Spring 2013">SMWCon Spring 2013</a></b> homepage. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fr%C3%BChjahr_2013_findet_in_New_York_City_statt" title="SMWCon Fr\ufffd\ufffdhjahr 2013 findet in New York City statt">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2013_gaat_plaatsvinden_in_New_York_City" title="SMWCon Spring 2013 gaat plaatsvinden in New York City">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Spring 2013 to be held in New York City</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Web_Platform_Docs_wiki_launched</id>   <title>Web Platform Docs wiki launched</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Web_Platform_Docs_wiki_launched"/>     <updated>2012-10-09T23:39:28Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Web Platform Docs wiki launched<p>October 8, 2012. A new reference site for web developers, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://webplatform.org">WebPlatform.org</a>, was launched by a consortium of companies and organizations that includes the W3C, Adobe, Facebook, Google, HP, Microsoft, Nokia, Mozilla and Opera. The core of the site is <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://docs.webplatform.org/wiki/Main_Page">Web Platform Docs</a>, a wiki that holds information about web syntax and development. Web Platform Docs runs on Semantic MediaWiki, and makes extensive use of SMW and related extensions such as <a href="/wiki/Semantic_Forms" title="Semantic Forms">Semantic Forms</a>. </p><p>WebPlatform.org and Web Platform Docs have already received coverage in online news sources such as <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.webmonkey.com/2012/10/w3c-helps-you-build-a-better-web-with-web-platform-docs/">Wired Webmonkey</a>, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://techcrunch.com/2012/10/08/google-microsoft-facebook-and-others-launch-web-platform-docs-a-web-standards-documentation-site/">TechCrunch</a>, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.engadget.com/2012/10/09/w3c-teams-with-apple-google-mozilla-on-webplatform/">Engadget</a> and <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://thenextweb.com/insider/2012/10/08/apple-facebook-google-microsoft-and-others-join-forces-to-launch-new-web-standards-resource/">TheNextWeb</a>, though so far with little mention of the technology used to power the site. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Wiki_%E2%80%9EWeb_Platform_Docs%E2%80%9C_wurde_gestartet" title="Wiki \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdWeb Platform Docs\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd wurde gestartet">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Web_Platform_Docs_wiki_gelanceerd" title="Web Platform Docs wiki gelanceerd">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Web Platform Docs wiki launched</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Keynote_about_Wikidata_at_SMWCon_Fall_2012</id>   <title>Keynote about Wikidata at SMWCon Fall 2012</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Keynote_about_Wikidata_at_SMWCon_Fall_2012"/>     <updated>2012-08-12T22:43:54Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Keynote about Wikidata at SMWCon Fall 2012<p>August 13, 2012.  The first keynote presentation of the upcoming SMWCon in Cologne (K\ufffd\ufffdln), Germany (October 24-26, 2012) has been confirmed. Denny Vrande\ufffd\ufffdi\ufffd\ufffd will present the <b>Wikidata project</b> of Wikimedia Deutschland.  The goal of project is to create the foundation for structured data and to make this data accessible within Wikipedia. Denny will introduce the project, show the current status and discuss possibilities for collaboration between SMW and Wikidata. </p><p>For more information about the conference, see the <b><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012" title="SMWCon Fall 2012">SMWCon Fall 2012</a></b> homepage.  If you plan to contribute a presentation please add yourself to the <a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012" title="SMWCon Fall 2012">wiki page</a> or contact the program chair  <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="mailto:katkov.juriy@gmail.com">Yury Katkov</a>. If you want to register go to the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://de.amiando.com/SMWcon2012.html">ticketing site</a>.  </p><p><br /> </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><a href="/w/index.php?title=SMWCon_Fall_2012/Wikidata_keynote_confirmed&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="SMWCon Fall 2012/Wikidata keynote confirmed (page does not exist)">SMWCon_Fall_2012/Wikidata_keynote_confirmed</a> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Michael Erdmann</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012_registration_open</id>   <title>SMWCon Fall 2012 registration open</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012_registration_open"/>     <updated>2012-08-02T02:16:09Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Fall 2012 registration open<p>July 28, 2012. The registration site for the next SMWCon in Cologne (K\ufffd\ufffdln), Germany (October 24-26, 2012) is available from now on. All interested participants can register at the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://de.amiando.com/SMWcon2012.html">ticketing site</a>. </p><p>For more information, see the <b><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012" title="SMWCon Fall 2012">SMWCon Fall 2012</a></b> homepage. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Anmeldung_zur_SMWCon_Herbst_2012_nun_m%C3%B6glich" title="Anmeldung zur SMWCon Herbst 2012 nun m\ufffd\ufffdglich">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon_Fall_2012_registration_open</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Yaron Koren</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012_to_be_held_in_Cologne,_Germany</id>   <title>SMWCon Fall 2012 to be held in Cologne, Germany</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012_to_be_held_in_Cologne,_Germany"/>     <updated>2012-06-19T12:59:49Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Fall 2012 to be held in Cologne, Germany<p>June 19, 2012. The location and dates of the next <a href="/wiki/SMWCon" title="SMWCon">SMWCon</a>, or Semantic MediaWiki Conference, have been announced: it will be held at <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.gesis.org/en/">GESIS - Leibniz Institute for the Social Sciences</a> in Cologne (K\ufffd\ufffdln), Germany on October 24-26, 2012. The first day will include tutorials for beginners to SMW; this will be followed by a two-day regular conference. </p><p>For more information, see the <b><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012" title="SMWCon Fall 2012">SMWCon Fall 2012</a></b> homepage. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Herbst_2012_findet_in_K%C3%B6ln_statt" title="SMWCon Herbst 2012 findet in K\ufffd\ufffdln statt">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2012_te_houden_in_Keulen,_Duitsland" title="SMWCon Fall 2012 te houden in Keulen, Duitsland">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Fall 2012 to be held in Cologne, Germany</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Yaron Koren</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/NYCFacets_wins_NYC_BigApps_competition_grand_prize</id>   <title>NYCFacets wins NYC BigApps competition grand prize</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/NYCFacets_wins_NYC_BigApps_competition_grand_prize"/>     <updated>2012-04-18T11:40:52Z</updated>      <summary type="html">NYCFacets wins NYC BigApps competition grand prize<p>April 17 2012. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://nycfacets.com">NYCFacets</a>, a Semantic MediaWiki-based site that holds detailed information about the open data sets provided by New York City government agencies, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://online.wsj.com/article/APc61f40838b4d4b13ba17b2d95abc6c7c.html">won the grand prize</a> of $10,000 at the 3rd annual <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://challenges.nycbigapps.com">NYC BigApps</a> competition, a contest to find software applications that use New York City's open data in creative and useful ways. NYCFacets was among the few entrants that is not a consumer application, but rather a resource for other developers. </p><p>NYCFacets was created by Ontodia, a company run by longtime SMW community member <a href="/wiki/Joel_Natividad" title="Joel Natividad" class="mw-redirect">Joel Natividad</a> and Sami Baig.  </p><p>NYCFacets makes significant use of Semantic MediaWiki and many of its related extensions. It was previously the <a href="/wiki/NYCFacets" title="NYCFacets">SMW wiki of the month</a> in March 2012. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/NYCFacets_gewinnt_den_Hauptpreis_des_NCY-BigApps-Wettbewerbs" title="NYCFacets gewinnt den Hauptpreis des NCY-BigApps-Wettbewerbs">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/NYCFacets_wint_de_hoofdprijs_in_de_NYC_BigApps_competitie" title="NYCFacets wint de hoofdprijs in de NYC BigApps competitie">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">NYCFacets wins NYC BigApps competition grand prize</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Yaron Koren</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Wikidata_to_Bring_Semantic_Data_to_Wikipedia</id>   <title>Wikidata to Bring Semantic Data to Wikipedia</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Wikidata_to_Bring_Semantic_Data_to_Wikipedia"/>     <updated>2012-03-30T21:48:09Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Wikidata to Bring Semantic Data to Wikipedia<p>March 30 2012. The <a href="http://meta.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikidata" class="extiw" title="meta:Wikidata">Wikidata project</a> is a major effort to establish a platform for editing and sharing data among all Wikipedia communities. The project will start next Monday, 2 April 2012. Wikidata will draw from the experience of <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki" title="Semantic MediaWiki">Semantic MediaWiki</a> in managing data in wikis, and SMW maintainers <a href="/wiki/Denny_Vrandecic" title="Denny Vrandecic" class="mw-redirect">Denny Vrandecic</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jeroen_De_Dauw" title="Jeroen De Dauw" class="mw-redirect">Jeroen De Dauw</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Markus_Kr%C3%B6tzsch" title="Markus Kr\ufffd\ufffdtzsch" class="mw-redirect">Markus Kr\ufffd\ufffdtzsch</a> are closely involved. However, there will also be some important differences, e.g., regarding user interface and translation support. Technical details are published on the <a href="http://meta.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikidata" class="extiw" title="meta:Wikidata">Wikidata pages</a> and there is a dedicated <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://lists.wikimedia.org/mailman/listinfo/wikidata-l">Wikidata mailing list</a> for updates and discussions. Official details about the project can be found in a recent press release by Wikimedia Deutschland e. V.: <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.wikimedia.de/wiki/Pressemitteilungen/PM_3_12_Wikidata">Data Revolution for Wikipedia</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Wikidata_soll_Wikipedia_semantische_Daten_bringen" title="Wikidata soll Wikipedia semantische Daten bringen">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Wikidata_gaat_Wikipedia_Semantische_Data_brengen" title="Wikidata gaat Wikipedia Semantische Data brengen">nl</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-zh-hans"><a href="/wiki/%E7%BB%B4%E5%9F%BA%E6%95%B0%E6%8D%AE%E5%8D%B3%E5%B0%86%E4%B8%BA%E7%BB%B4%E5%9F%BA%E7%99%BE%E7%A7%91%E5%B8%A6%E6%9D%A5%E8%AF%AD%E4%B9%89%E6%95%B0%E6%8D%AE" title="\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd">zh-hans</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Wikidata to Bring Semantic Data to Wikipedia</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1_released"/>     <updated>2012-03-07T01:55:05Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1 released<p>March 5 2012. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1">Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1</a>, the next minor version after 1.7.0, has now been released.</b> This new version adds a few cool new features and fixes a pile of bugs. Uprading from 1.7.0 can be done by replacing the files and running the database upgrade script. Upgrading from earlier versions of SMW is easy but needs some additional steps in certain cases, see <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation_1.7.1" title="Help:Installation 1.7.1">Installation 1.7.1</a> for details. Further information can be found on the <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1">SMW 1.7.1 page</a>. </p><p>The next release on our roadmap is SMW 1.8 which will drop support for MediaWiki 1.16.x and bring improvements to resource loading and many other things. </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-fr"><a href="/wiki/Sortie_de_Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1" title="Sortie de Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1">fr</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1_uitgebracht" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1 uitgebracht">nl</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-zh-hans"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1%E7%89%88%E5%B7%B2%E5%8F%91%E5%B8%83" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd">zh-hans</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Chapter_by_Markus_Kr%C3%B6tzsch_in_new_book,_%22Open_Advice%22</id>   <title>Chapter by Markus Kr\ufffd\ufffdtzsch in new book, "Open Advice"</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Chapter_by_Markus_Kr%C3%B6tzsch_in_new_book,_%22Open_Advice%22"/>     <updated>2012-02-22T21:06:34Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Chapter by Markus Kr\ufffd\ufffdtzsch in new book, "Open Advice"<p>February 19 2012. Semantic MediaWiki lead developer <a href="/wiki/Markus_Kr%C3%B6tzsch" title="Markus Kr\ufffd\ufffdtzsch" class="mw-redirect">Markus Kr\ufffd\ufffdtzsch</a> is the author of a chapter in the new book <i><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://open-advice.org/">Open Advice</a></i>, a compendium of advice about free and open-source development from various open-source leaders. In his chapter, titled "Out of the Lab, into the Wild: Growing Open Source Communities around Academic Projects", Markus talks about the steps academic researchers can take to help the open-source software that they have created succeed, including choosing popular technology, documenting the code, keeping all communication and development public, and publicizing the software. </p><p><i>Open Advice</i> was edited by <a href="/wiki/Lydia_Pintscher" title="Lydia Pintscher" class="mw-redirect">Lydia Pintscher</a>, a member of the Semantic MediaWiki community (as well as of the open-source software KDE), and the book's <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://open-advice.org/author.html">authors</a> include others with connections to MediaWiki, including Lydia herself, Wikimedia Foundation developer Guillaume Paumier, Wikipedia researcher Felipe Ortega, and Wikitravel (and StatusNet) founder Evan Prodromou. <i>Open Advice</i> is itself available under an open source license. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Kapitel_von_Markus_Kr%C3%B6tzsch_im_neuen_Buch_%E2%80%9EOpen_Advice%E2%80%9C" title="Kapitel von Markus Kr\ufffd\ufffdtzsch im neuen Buch \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOpen Advice\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Hoofdstuk_door_Markus_Kr%C3%B6tzsch_in_nieuw_boek,_%22Open_Advice%22" title="Hoofdstuk door Markus Kr\ufffd\ufffdtzsch in nieuw boek, &quot;Open Advice&quot;">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Chapter by Markus Kr\ufffd\ufffdtzsch in new book, "Open Advice"</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1_beta</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1 beta</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1_beta"/>     <updated>2012-04-13T20:31:51Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1 beta<p>February 15 2012. The first beta release of <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1">Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1</a>, the next minor version after 1.7.0</b>, is now available. This is a <b>beta release</b> and <b>should not be used on production wikis</b>! So far 1.7.1 brings a ton of bugfixes and some minor additions. </p> <div id="toc" class="toc"><div id="toctitle"><h2>Contents</h2></div> <ul> <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1"><a href="#Download"><span class="tocnumber">1</span> <span class="toctext">Download</span></a></li> <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-2"><a href="#Install_.2F_upgrade"><span class="tocnumber">2</span> <span class="toctext">Install / upgrade</span></a></li> <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-3"><a href="#Changes"><span class="tocnumber">3</span> <span class="toctext">Changes</span></a></li> <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-4"><a href="#Testing_and_reporting_issues"><span class="tocnumber">4</span> <span class="toctext">Testing and reporting issues</span></a></li> </ul> </div>  <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Download">Download</span></h2> <ul><li> Tarballs: <a rel="nofollow" class="external free" href="https://sourceforge.net/projects/semediawiki/files/semediawiki/Semantic%20MediaWiki%201.7.1%20beta%201/">https://sourceforge.net/projects/semediawiki/files/semediawiki/Semantic%20MediaWiki%201.7.1%20beta%201/</a></li> <li> SVN tag: <a rel="nofollow" class="external free" href="http://svn.wikimedia.org/svnroot/mediawiki/tags/extensions/SemanticMediaWiki/REL_1_7_1beta1/">http://svn.wikimedia.org/svnroot/mediawiki/tags/extensions/SemanticMediaWiki/REL_1_7_1beta1/</a></li></ul> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Install_.2F_upgrade">Install / upgrade</span></h2> <p>You can just replace the old files with the new. No further steps are needed. Furthermore, no compatibility breaking changes have been made. </p> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Changes">Changes</span></h2> <ul><li> Added "Last editor is" and "Is a new page" special properties (bug 34359).</li> <li> Added basic support for OpenLink Virtuoso RDF database. In addition to <code>$smwgDefaultStore = 'SMWSparqlStore'</code>, users should set <code>$smwgSparqlDatabase = 'SMWSparqlDatabaseVirtuoso'</code> and use Virtuoso's SPARQL endpoint at <code>./sparql/</code> for query and update alike. for further remarks and known limitations, see the file <code>./includes/sparql/SMW_SparqlDatabaseVirtuoso.php</code>.</li> <li> Added ability to sort dates as dates in tables generated by SMW (bug 25768).</li> <li> When there are only invalid query conditions, query answering is stopped (bug 33177).</li> <li> Fixed display of nearby values on Special:SearchByProperty (bug 34178).</li> <li> Fixed display of URL values (bug 34312, 34044).</li> <li> Fixed warning when browsing certain property pages (bug 34306).</li> <li> Fixed failure of SMW_setup --delete when using PostgreSQL (bug 31153).</li> <li> Fixed division by 0 error when setting the "Corresponds to" property to 0 (bug 32594).</li> <li> Fixed accept header send with SPARQL query requests (bug 32280).</li> <li> Fixed unresolved prefixed name in SPARQL queries (bug 33687).</li> <li> Fixed issues with modification date property occurring when using SMWSparqlStore (bug 30989).</li> <li> Fixed erroneous SPARQL for property value comparison queries (bug 30993).</li> <li> Fixed broken +index=x for records (bug 30284).</li> <li> Fixed querying of subobjects using 4store as a datastore.</li> <li> Fixed issue with namespace internationalization (bug 34383).</li></ul> <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Testing_and_reporting_issues">Testing and reporting issues</span></h2> <p>If you find any issues with this beta release, please report them on <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://bugzilla.wikimedia.org/">bugzilla</a> under <code>extensions/SemanticMediaWiki</code>, or on <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_mailing_lists" title="Semantic MediaWiki mailing lists">the semediawiki-user mailing list</a>, so they can be addressed before the actual release. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1_beta_1_kann_getestet_werden" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1 beta 1 kann getestet werden">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-fr"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1_beta_(fr)" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1 beta (fr)">fr</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-zh-hans"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.1_beta%E6%B5%8B%E8%AF%95%E7%89%88" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1 beta\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd">zh-hans</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.1 beta</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.0_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.0 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.0_released"/>     <updated>2012-01-03T02:04:36Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.0 released<p>Jan 1 2012. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.0" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.0">Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.0</a>, the next major version after 1.6.1, has now been released.</b> This new version brings a significant number of internal changes and fixes. Notable additions are native <a href="/wiki/Subobjects" title="Subobjects" class="mw-redirect">subobjects</a>, an <a href="/wiki/Ask_API" title="Ask API">Ask API</a> and an alpha version of Special:QueryCreator. Upgrading from earlier versions of SMW is easy but needs some additional steps in certain cases, see <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation_1.7.0" title="Help:Installation 1.7.0">Installation 1.7.0</a> for details. Further information can be found on the <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.0" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.0">SMW 1.7.0 page</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.0_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.0 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-fr"><a href="/wiki/Lancement_de_Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.0" title="Lancement de Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.0">fr</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.7.0_uitgebracht" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.0 uitgebracht">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 1.7.0 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Yaron Koren</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2012_to_be_held_in_Carlsbad,_California</id>   <title>SMWCon Spring 2012 to be held in Carlsbad, California</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2012_to_be_held_in_Carlsbad,_California"/>     <updated>2011-12-02T15:54:17Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Spring 2012 to be held in Carlsbad, California<p>November 30, 2011. The location and dates of the next <a href="/wiki/SMWCon" title="SMWCon">SMWCon</a>, or Semantic MediaWiki Conference, have been announced: it will be held at the Tri-City Wellness Center in Carlsbad, California, USA (a city located between San Diego and Los Angeles) on April 25-27, 2012. The event will be sponsored by <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.ai-one.com/">ai-one</a>, a San Diego software company. The first day will include tutorials for beginners to SMW; this will be followed by a two-day regular conference. </p><p>For more information, see the <b><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2012" title="SMWCon Spring 2012">SMWCon Spring 2012</a></b> homepage. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fr%C3%BChjahr_2012_in_Carlsbad,_Kalifornien" title="SMWCon Fr\ufffd\ufffdhjahr 2012 in Carlsbad, Kalifornien">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Spring 2012 to be held in Carlsbad, California</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011_talks_and_presentations_on_YouTube</id>   <title>SMWCon Fall 2011 talks and presentations on YouTube</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011_talks_and_presentations_on_YouTube"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:53:15Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Fall 2011 talks and presentations on YouTube<p>November 1, 2011. Videos of talks and presentations from <b><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011" title="SMWCon Fall 2011">SMWCon Fall 2011</a></b>, which was held on September 21-23 in Berlin, Germany, have been uploaded to YouTube. The entire set of links to the videos is viewable <a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011#Presentation_Videos" title="SMWCon Fall 2011">here</a>. The event itself was a big success, with about 40 attendees representing developers and users from all over the world. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Videomitschnitte_der_SMWCon_Herbst_2011_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Videomitschnitte der SMWCon Herbst 2011 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Fall 2011 talks and presentations on YouTube</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Wikimedia_Deutschland_is_hiring_for_the_Wikidata_project</id>   <title>Wikimedia Deutschland is hiring for the Wikidata project</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Wikimedia_Deutschland_is_hiring_for_the_Wikidata_project"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:53:38Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Wikimedia Deutschland is hiring for the Wikidata project<p>Oct 28 2011. <b>Wikimedia Deutschland is hiring for the Wikidata project</b> </p><p><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://wikimedia.de/wiki/Hauptseite">Wikimedia Deutschland</a>, the German chapter of the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Home">Wikimedia Foundation</a>, just started to hire for the new <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/New_Wikidata">Wikidata</a> project. Wikidata is a project aiming to create a common repository for information similar to the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Main_Page">Wikimedia Commons</a> repository of files. In this way it will be possible to integrate information like the number of inhabitants of Berlin into all language versions of an article automatically, rather than doing this manually as is the case now. <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki" title="Semantic MediaWiki">Semantic MediaWiki</a> is planned to be a main component of Wikidata. See <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://wikimedia.de/wiki/WikiData_Jobs">here</a> for the current job openings. </p><p>Recently the renowned German portal on information technology "heise online" published an article about the envisioned Wikidata project. Read the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.heise.de/newsticker/meldung/Wikimedia-baut-Wikipedia-Datenbank-1367255.html">full story</a> (German). </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Wikimedia_Deutschland_sucht_Mitarbeiter_f%C3%BCr_das_Wikidata-Projekt" title="Wikimedia Deutschland sucht Mitarbeiter f\ufffd\ufffdr das Wikidata-Projekt">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Wikimedia Deutschland is hiring for the Wikidata project</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_celebrates_its_6th_anniversary</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki celebrates its 6th anniversary</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_celebrates_its_6th_anniversary"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:53:52Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki celebrates its 6th anniversary<p>Sep 30 2011. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki" title="Semantic MediaWiki">Semantic MediaWiki</a> celebrates its 6th anniversary</b> </p><p>This day in 2005 the very first version of Semantic MediaWiki (SMW 0.1) was released. What started as an <a href="/wiki/Help:SMW_Project" title="Help:SMW Project">academic project</a> has now evolved into a mature and serious software suite enhancing <a href="/wiki/MediaWiki" title="MediaWiki">MediaWiki</a> to take advantage of the possibilities provided by the <a href="/wiki/Semantic_Web" title="Semantic Web">Semantic Web</a>. "Making your wiki more accessible - for humans and machines" was the principal idea of Semantic MediaWiki during these years, which will continue to accompany its further development. </p><p>Since Semantic MediaWiki 0.1 a lot of features have been added to the software, and just last week Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.2 was released. See the <a href="/wiki/Help:SMW_History" title="Help:SMW History">version history</a> for more details. Also, many useful <a href="/wiki/Help:SMW_extensions" title="Help:SMW extensions">semantic extensions</a> have been been created to provide extra functionality, most notably <a href="/wiki/Semantic_Forms" title="Semantic Forms">Semantic Forms</a>, <a href="/wiki/Semantic_Result_Formats" title="Semantic Result Formats">Semantic Result Formats</a> and <a href="/wiki/Halo" title="Halo">Halo</a>. </p><p>Also an active community of both developers and users has established itself around Semantic MediaWiki and is still gaining momentum. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_feiert_seinen_6._Jahrestag" title="Semantic MediaWiki feiert seinen 6. Jahrestag">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki celebrates its 6th anniversary</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Free_Software_Directory_re-launched_with_Semantic_MediaWiki</id>   <title>Free Software Directory re-launched with Semantic MediaWiki</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Free_Software_Directory_re-launched_with_Semantic_MediaWiki"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:54:06Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Free Software Directory re-launched with Semantic MediaWiki<p>Sep 29 2011. <b>Free Software Directory re-launched with Semantic MediaWiki</b> </p><p>The <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.fsf.org/">Free Software Foundation</a>, a pioneering organization best known for creating GNU as well as the GNU General Public License, has since 2002 also run the "Free Software Directory", a website listing free and open-source software. Today it re-launched the site as a wiki running Semantic MediaWiki, in order to allow users to directly add to and modify the site's contents, as well as to improve searching. In a <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.fsf.org/news/directory-relaunch">press release</a>, the FSF said the change will make the site "a more useful and current resource". </p><p>You can view the new Free Software Directory <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://directory.fsf.org/wiki/Main_Page">here</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/%E2%80%9EFree_Software_Directory%E2%80%9C_mit_Semantic_MediaWiki_neu_gestartet" title="\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFree Software Directory\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd mit Semantic MediaWiki neu gestartet">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Free Software Directory re-launched with Semantic MediaWiki</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011_successfully_held</id>   <title>SMWCon Fall 2011 successfully held</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011_successfully_held"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:54:24Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Fall 2011 successfully held<p>Sep 23 2011. <b>After three successful days <a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011" title="SMWCon Fall 2011">SMWCon Fall 2011</a> ended</b> </p><p>More that 40 users, developers and enthusiasts participated at SMWCon Fall 2011 in Berlin. It provided in the context of <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki" title="Semantic MediaWiki">Semantic MediaWiki</a> (SMW) an insight into <a href="/wiki/Semantic_Web" title="Semantic Web">Semantic Web</a> technologies that empower linked data. Another main topic were the latest developments concerning SMW and related software itself. All of this was supplemented with inspiring examples of how to implement all of this. </p><p>The slides and documents are already available via the <a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011" title="SMWCon Fall 2011">main conference page</a>. Additionally, videos of the conference will be made available on YouTube later on. </p><p>A big thank you goes to all the people organising, supporting and attending this event. See you next <a href="/wiki/SMWCon" title="SMWCon">SMWCon</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Herbst_2011_war_ein_voller_Erfolg" title="SMWCon Herbst 2011 war ein voller Erfolg">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Najaar_2011_succesvol_afgesloten" title="SMWCon Najaar 2011 succesvol afgesloten">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Fall 2011 successfully held</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.2_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.2 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.2_released"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:54:39Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.2 released<p>Sep 20 2011. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.2" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.2">Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.2</a> has been released and is now available for <a href="/wiki/Help:Download" title="Help:Download">download</a>.</b> This minor release mainly contains bug fixes and some small new features and tweaks. See <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation_1.6.2" title="Help:Installation 1.6.2" class="mw-redirect">Installation 1.6.2</a> for installation details. Further information can be found on the <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.2" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.2">SMW 1.6.2 page</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.2_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.2 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.2_uitgebracht" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.2 uitgebracht">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.2 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.1_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.1 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.1_released"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:54:52Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.1 released<p>Aug 20 2011. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.1" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.1">Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.1</a> has been released and is now available for <a href="/wiki/Help:Download" title="Help:Download">download</a>.</b> This minor release mainly contains bug fixes and function tweaks. See <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation_1.6.1" title="Help:Installation 1.6.1" class="mw-redirect">Installation 1.6.1</a> for installation details. Further information can be found on the <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.1" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.1">SMW 1.6.1 page</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.1_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.1 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.1_uitgebracht" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.1 uitgebracht">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.1 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011_registration_now_open</id>   <title>SMWCon Fall 2011 registration now open</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011_registration_now_open"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:55:08Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Fall 2011 registration now openAug 12, 2011. We are happy to announce that you can now register for <a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011" title="SMWCon Fall 2011">SMWCon Fall 2011</a> in Berlin on September 21\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd23, 2011. Registration is found at <a rel="nofollow" class="external free" href="http://de.amiando.com/SMWCon_Fall_2011">http://de.amiando.com/SMWCon_Fall_2011</a>. <div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a href="/wiki/File:5072461976_666f3c8817_o.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="/w/images/thumb/9/96/5072461976_666f3c8817_o.jpg/300px-5072461976_666f3c8817_o.jpg" width="300" height="199" class="thumbimage" srcset="/w/images/thumb/9/96/5072461976_666f3c8817_o.jpg/450px-5072461976_666f3c8817_o.jpg 1.5x, /w/images/thumb/9/96/5072461976_666f3c8817_o.jpg/600px-5072461976_666f3c8817_o.jpg 2x" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:5072461976_666f3c8817_o.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>World time clock and TV tower on Alexanderplatz</div></div></div> <p>SMWCon brings together developers, users, and organizations from the <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki" title="Semantic MediaWiki">Semantic MediaWiki</a> community in particular and everyone interested in managing data in wikis in general.
