The Fall 2011 event runs for three days September 21\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd23, 2011: </p> <ul><li> Sept 21: practical tutorials about using SMW (learn about essential aspects of using SMW) + developer consultation (meet with all developers and discuss technical questions)</li> <li> Sept 22\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd23: community conference with talks and discussions</li></ul> <p>The detailed program is <a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011#Program" title="SMWCon Fall 2011">about to take shape</a>. Contributions are still possible. Please note that the event takes place at the time of the famous Berlin Marathon and a visit of Pope Benedict XVI. Booking hotels soon is recommended. </p><p>You can register for the whole event or for the conference days only. Registration includes lunch and coffee on all days + a conference dinner on Sept 22nd. Special subsidised rates are available for students. Moreover, MediaWiki developers are invited to join the first day (in particular the developer consultations) at a reduced rate. </p><p>We are stretching ourselves to keep rates as low as possible in spite of additional costs incurred by the rooms this time. We are therefore welcoming sponsors to help back up the finances of the meeting, now and in the future. If your organisation would be interested in becoming an official supporter of the event, please contact the <a href="/wiki/Open_Semantic_Data_Association" title="Open Semantic Data Association">Open Semantic Data Association</a> &lt;osda@semantic-mediawiki.org&gt;. </p><p>SMWCon Fall 2011 is organised by the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.wiwiss.fu-berlin.de/en/institute/pwo/bizer/index.html">Web-Based Systems Group at Free University Berlin</a> and by <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://mediaeventservices.com/">MediaEvent Services</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Herbst_2011_-_Anmeldung_nun_m%C3%B6glich" title="SMWCon Herbst 2011 - Anmeldung nun m\ufffd\ufffdglich">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Najaar_2011_registratie_nu_open" title="SMWCon Najaar 2011 registratie nu open">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Fall 2011 registration now open</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SNPedia-Gene_Wiki_mashup_-_joining_two_wikis_via_RDF_and_SPARQL_using_Semantic_MediaWiki</id>   <title>SNPedia-Gene Wiki mashup - joining two wikis via RDF and SPARQL using Semantic MediaWiki</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SNPedia-Gene_Wiki_mashup_-_joining_two_wikis_via_RDF_and_SPARQL_using_Semantic_MediaWiki"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:55:27Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SNPedia-Gene Wiki mashup - joining two wikis via RDF and SPARQL using Semantic MediaWiki<p>August 10, 2011. <b>The SNPedia-Gene Wiki mashup is the first known case of joining the information of two wikis via RDF and SPARQL using Semantic MediaWiki</b> A paper was published by Benjamin M. Good, Salvatore Loguercio and Andrew I. Su describing how two wikis, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.snpedia.com/index.php/SNPedia">SNPedia</a> and <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene_Wiki">Gene Wiki</a> were used to integrate and assemble separately collected data into a "meta-wiki" by utilising the abilities of <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki" title="Semantic MediaWiki">Semantic MediaWiki</a> to handle the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resource_Description_Framework">Resource Description Framework (RDF)</a> via its standard query language <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SPARQL">SPARQL</a>. Thus 4,426 distinct gene-disease relationships were captured between the two wikis. Read the full story at <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://bio-ontologies.knowledgeblog.org/250">bio-ontologies.knowledgeblog.org</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/SNPedia-Gene_Wiki_-_Zusammenf%C3%BChrung_zweier_Wikis_mit_RDF_und_SPARQL_durch_Semantic_MediaWiki" title="SNPedia-Gene Wiki - Zusammenf\ufffd\ufffdhrung zweier Wikis mit RDF und SPARQL durch Semantic MediaWiki">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/SNPedia-Gene_Wiki_mashup_-_twee_wikis_samenvoegen_via_RDF_en_SPARQL_met_Semantic_MediaWiki" title="SNPedia-Gene Wiki mashup - twee wikis samenvoegen via RDF en SPARQL met Semantic MediaWiki">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SNPedia-Gene Wiki mashup - joining two wikis via RDF and SPARQL using Semantic MediaWiki</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.0_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.0 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.0_released"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:55:45Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.0 released<p>July 30 2011. <b>The new version of SMW, <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.0" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.0">Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.0</a>, has now been released.</b> In this new major version, <a href="/wiki/SMW" title="SMW" class="mw-redirect">SMW</a> has again seen a significant number of internal changes for better extendibility and less bugs. Notable changes are full support of <i>synchronization of SMW with external RDF stores</i>, major <i>reorganization concerning datatypes</i> (namespace Type abolished, no custom datatypes, changes to datatypes <a href="/wiki/Help:Type_Number" title="Help:Type Number">Number</a> and <a href="/wiki/Help:Type_Number" title="Help:Type Number">Record</a>, built in properties for every supported datatype), new built in <i>result format DSV</i> (Delimiter-separated values), improved <i>error reporting for ask queries</i>, improved <i>support for PostgreSQL</i>. Upgrading from earlier versions of SMW is easy but needs some additional steps in certain cases, see <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation_1.6.0" title="Help:Installation 1.6.0" class="mw-redirect">Installation 1.6.0</a> for details. Further information is found on the <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.0" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.0">SMW 1.6.0 page</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.0_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.0 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.6.0_uitgebracht" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.0 uitgebracht">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 1.6.0 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Call_for_presentations_for_SMWCon_Fall_2011</id>   <title>Call for presentations for SMWCon Fall 2011</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Call_for_presentations_for_SMWCon_Fall_2011"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:55:58Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Call for presentations for SMWCon Fall 2011<p>July 25, 2011. <a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011" title="SMWCon Fall 2011">SMWCon Fall 2011</a>, the upcoming installment of <a href="/wiki/SMWCon" title="SMWCon">SMWCon</a>, or the Semantic MediaWiki Conference, to be held in Berlin, Germany on September 21-23, 2011, is looking for talks and presentations by all interested users and developers. Proposals for talks should be added to the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011#Conference_days">list on the wiki page</a>. Expert users can also <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011#Tutorial_Day">propose tutorials</a>, for the tutorial day on September 21. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Call_for_papers_-_SMWCon_Herbst_2011" title="Call for papers - SMWCon Herbst 2011">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Oproep_voor_presentaties_voor_SMWCon_herfst_2011" title="Oproep voor presentaties voor SMWCon herfst 2011">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Call for presentations for SMWCon Fall 2011</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMW_on_Twitter_and_identi.ca</id>   <title>SMW on Twitter and identi.ca</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMW_on_Twitter_and_identi.ca"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:56:14Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMW on Twitter and identi.ca<p>July 15, 2011. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki" title="Semantic MediaWiki">Semantic MediaWiki</a></b> now has accounts on Twitter and identi.ca in order to provide more regular updates on SMW and its extensions. You can now follow us at <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://twitter.com/#!/SemanticMW">Twitter</a> and <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://identi.ca/smw">indenti.ca</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/SMW_nun_bei_Twitter_und_identi.ca" title="SMW nun bei Twitter und identi.ca">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/SMW_op_Twitter_en_identi.ca" title="SMW op Twitter en identi.ca">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMW on Twitter and identi.ca</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011_to_be_held_in_Berlin</id>   <title>SMWCon Fall 2011 to be held in Berlin</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011_to_be_held_in_Berlin"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:56:28Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Fall 2011 to be held in Berlin<p>June 13, 2011. The location and dates of the next <a href="/wiki/SMWCon" title="SMWCon">SMWCon</a>, or Semantic MediaWiki Conference, have been announced: it will be held at the Free University of Berlin in Berlin, Germany, on September 21-23, 2011. The event will be hosted by the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.wiwiss.fu-berlin.de/en/institute/pwo/bizer/index.html">Web-Based Systems Group</a> headed by Dr. Christian Bizer, a group that is responsible for some of the most well-known projects of the Semantic Web, including <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://dbpedia.org/About">DBpedia</a>, a project that shares some of the same goals of Semantic MediaWiki. The first day will include tutorials for beginners to SMW, as well as discussions with developers for more advanced users; this will be followed by a two-day regular conference. </p><p>For more information, see the <b><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011" title="SMWCon Fall 2011">SMWCon Fall 2011</a></b> homepage. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Herbst_2011_in_Berlin" title="SMWCon Herbst 2011 in Berlin">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Fall_2011_wordt_gehouden_in_Berlijn" title="SMWCon Fall 2011 wordt gehouden in Berlijn">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Fall 2011 to be held in Berlin</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2011_talks_on_YouTube</id>   <title>SMWCon Spring 2011 talks on YouTube</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2011_talks_on_YouTube"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:56:42Z</updated>      <summary type="html">SMWCon Spring 2011 talks on YouTube<p>May 23, 2011. Videos of talks from <b><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2011" title="SMWCon Spring 2011">SMWCon Spring 2011</a></b>, which was held on April 28-30 in Arlington, Virginia (near Washington, D.C.), have been uploaded to YouTube. The entire set of links to the videos is viewable <i><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2011#Video" title="SMWCon Spring 2011">here</a></i>. The event itself was a success, with over 30 attendees representing developers and users from Washington, D.C., the rest of the United States, Europe and Asia. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Videomitschnitte_der_SMWCon_Fr%C3%BChjahr_2011_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Videomitschnitte der SMWCon Fr\ufffd\ufffdhjahr 2011 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/SMWCon_Spring_2011_sessies_op_YouTube" title="SMWCon Spring 2011 sessies op YouTube">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">SMWCon Spring 2011 talks on YouTube</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Encyclopedia_Dramatica,_Oh_Internet_founder_praises_SMW</id>   <title>Encyclopedia Dramatica, Oh Internet founder praises SMW</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Encyclopedia_Dramatica,_Oh_Internet_founder_praises_SMW"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:56:56Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Encyclopedia Dramatica, Oh Internet founder praises SMW<p>Apr 17 2011. An April 16 post on popular American news-and-gossip blog <i>Gawker</i> featured an interview with Sherrod DeGrippo, who founded the wiki Encyclopedia Dramatica in 2005 and last week turned the site into a redirect to her new wiki, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://ohinternet.com">Oh Internet</a>. Oh Internet uses Semantic MediaWiki extensively, and DeGrippo cited SMW among the reasons why she made the replacement. DeGrippo called SMW "the best thing to ever happen to wikis. An amazing technology that allow for easier editing and querying... I am excited and I love it." </p><p>Read the entire post: "<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://gawker.com/#!5792738/what-happened-to-encyclopedia-dramatica">What Happened to Encyclopedia Dramatica?</a>", Max Read, <i>Gawker</i>, Apr 16, 2011 </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Gr%C3%BCnderin_von_%E2%80%9EOh_Internet%E2%80%9C_(%E2%80%9EEncyclopedia_Dramatica%E2%80%9C)_lobt_SMW" title="Gr\ufffd\ufffdnderin von \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOh Internet\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdEncyclopedia Dramatica\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd) lobt SMW">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Oprichter_van_Encyclopedia_Dramatica,_Oh_Internet,_prijst_SMW" title="Oprichter van Encyclopedia Dramatica, Oh Internet, prijst SMW">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Encyclopedia Dramatica, Oh Internet founder praises SMW</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Win_prizes_at_Halo_public_testing</id>   <title>Win prizes at Halo public testing</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Win_prizes_at_Halo_public_testing"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:57:12Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Win prizes at Halo public testing<p>Apr 14 2011. <b>Ontoprise is announcing a bug hunting competition for <a href="/wiki/Halo" title="Halo">Halo</a>.</b> To prepare the upcoming release of Halo 1.5.3, users are asked to help with beta testing, and get the chance to win some cool prizes in exchange. More information can be found at the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Contests/Public_Testing_Halo_153">Halo 1.5.3 public testing homepage</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Tester_gesucht_-_Preise_zu_gewinnen" title="Tester gesucht - Preise zu gewinnen">de</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Win prizes at Halo public testing</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/User_consultation:_How_do_you_use_RDF%3F</id>   <title>User consultation: How do you use RDF?</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/User_consultation:_How_do_you_use_RDF%3F"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:57:25Z</updated>      <summary type="html">User consultation: How do you use RDF?<p>Mar 15 2011. The <a href="/wiki/RDF_export" title="RDF export" class="mw-redirect">RDF export</a> of <a href="/wiki/SMW" title="SMW" class="mw-redirect">SMW</a> can be used in many ways to exchange data with other applications. In order to improve this feature, the <b>SMW developers are asking for user feedback</b>. How do you use RDF? Which tools are you using? Which other features would you like to see? To give your feedback, please answer this <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.surveymonkey.com/s/5WCQ898">short (one-page) survey</a>. All questions are optional, all feedback is welcome. Thanks for helping us to make SMW better! </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Nutzerumfrage:_Wie_nutzen_Sie_RDF%3F" title="Nutzerumfrage: Wie nutzen Sie RDF?">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Gebruikersraadpleging:_Hoe_gebruik_jij_RDF%3F" title="Gebruikersraadpleging: Hoe gebruik jij RDF?">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">User consultation: How do you use RDF?</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.5.6_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.6 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.5.6_released"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:57:39Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.6 released<p>Feb 24 2011. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.5.6" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.6">Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.6</a> has been released and is now available for <a href="/wiki/Help:Download" title="Help:Download">download</a>.</b> This minor release fixes a number of bugs, perhaps most notably the non-functional concept caching. It also introduces automatic refresh of pages after their semantic data is stored. See <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation_1.5.6" title="Help:Installation 1.5.6" class="mw-redirect">Installation 1.5.6</a> for installation details. Further information can be found on the <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.5.6" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.6">SMW 1.5.6 page</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.5.6_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.6 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.5.6_uitgebracht" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.6 uitgebracht">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.6 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_at_Deutschlandradio_Kultur</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki at Deutschlandradio Kultur</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_at_Deutschlandradio_Kultur"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:57:53Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki at Deutschlandradio Kultur<p>Jan 17 2011. A <b>radio interview with <a href="/wiki/Markus_Kr%C3%B6tzsch" title="Markus Kr\ufffd\ufffdtzsch" class="mw-redirect">Markus Kr\ufffd\ufffdtzsch</a> on <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki" title="Semantic MediaWiki">Semantic MediaWiki</a></b> has been aired on national German radio <i><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dradio.de/dkultur/">Deutschlandradio Kultur</a></i> on Saturday Jan 15. In the interview, Markus explains the basic concepts of SMW, and the potential use of this technology for Wikipedia. A record of the interview (in German) can be found online at <a rel="nofollow" class="external free" href="http://breitband.dradio.de/wikipedia-2-0/">http://breitband.dradio.de/wikipedia-2-0/</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_bei_Deutschlandradio_Kultur" title="Semantic MediaWiki bei Deutschlandradio Kultur">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_op_Deutschlandradio_Kultur" title="Semantic MediaWiki op Deutschlandradio Kultur">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki at Deutschlandradio Kultur</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   <entry>   <id>//semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.5.5_released</id>   <title>Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.5 released</title>   <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.5.5_released"/>     <updated>2011-11-06T15:58:10Z</updated>      <summary type="html">Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.5 released<p>Jan 12 2011. <b><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.5.5" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.5">Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.5</a> has been released and is now available for <a href="/wiki/Help:Download" title="Help:Download">download</a>.</b> This minor release brings several new RDF export capabilities and improves the existing ones, and addresses a number of bugs. See <a href="/wiki/Help:Installation_1.5.5" title="Help:Installation 1.5.5" class="mw-redirect">Installation 1.5.5</a> for installation details. Further information can be found on the <a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.5.5" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.5">SMW 1.5.5 page</a>. </p><p><br /> </p> <div style="text-align: center; background: #F7F7F7; border: 4px solid #B0BFE8; padding: 0.25em;"> <p>This page in other languages:  <span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-de"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.5.5_verf%C3%BCgbar" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.5 verf\ufffd\ufffdgbar">de</a></span>,&#160;<span style="text-transform: uppercase;" class="lang-nl"><a href="/wiki/Semantic_MediaWiki_1.5.5_uitgebracht" title="Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.5 uitgebracht">nl</a></span> </p> </div> <div style="display: none; read: none;"> <p><strong class="selflink">Semantic MediaWiki 1.5.5 released</strong> en  </p> </div> </summary>   <author><name>Kghbln</name></author> </entry>   </feed>
